noun.description: A member of an ancient Arabian people who from 312 BC formed an independent kingdom with its capital at Petra (now in Jordan).
The Aramaic dialect of the Nabataeans, strongly influenced by Arabic.

adjective.description: Relating to the Nabataeans or their language.

origin: From Latin Nabat(h)aeus, Greek Nabat(h)aios (compare with the Arabic adjective Nabaṭī relating to the Nabataeans) + -an.
